CatDescriptText: Mrs. Elsie W. Lewis, 1222 Girard Street, NW, Washington, D.C. , was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 19, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Should a church congregation pay its ministers not less than a 'cost-of-living' salary, maintain rent-free (with utilities) living quarters for him, pay for vacations for him and his family (if he has one) and, in some instances, hold special 'gratuity days' in his behalf, also?" answer reads: "In my denomination, which is Protestant Episcopal, there are no such problems because the ministers are paid by the diocese."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Elsie W. Lewis, wearing matching coat and hat, and eyeglasses, standing with left hand in pocket in front of lawn with stone retaining wall
